wikipedia_page.main: James Gillespie (22 March 1868 – 5 August 1932) was a Scottish footballer who played for Clyde, Sunderland Albion, Sunderland, Third Lanark, Ayr and Scotland.

response: * unknown date – James Gillespie (d. unknown), Scotland international forward in one match (1898), scoring a hat-trick; won the English league title with Sunderland in 1893 and 1895.

His only Scotland cap came in Scotland's 5–2 win over Wales on 19 March 1898 when he scored two goals, with the others from fellow debutant, James Gillespie.Saturday's Football.  Scotland Versus Wales., The Glasgow Herald, 21 March 1898 Though largely raised in Shotts, McKee was born in County Down in Ireland which should have disqualified him (and England-born teammate William Watson) from being selected under the rules of the time.The 'foreigners' who played for Scotland, Scottish Sport History, 10 July 2021
* James Gillespie (politician) (c. 1747–1805), U.S. Congressman from North Carolina
* James Gillespie (minister) (1720–1791), Scottish minister and theologian
* James Gillespie (philanthropist) (1726–1797), Scottish snuff and tobacco merchant
* James Gillespie Blaine, American politician and United States Secretary of State
* James Gillespie Birney, American abolitionist, politician, and two-time Liberty Party nominee for President
